questions.question:
Symptoms: restless, irritable, weak, confused, dizzy, afraid. Moist, clammy, cool, pale skin. Quick, weak pulse. Shallow, rapid, irregular breathing. Nauseated, vomiting. Extremely thirsty. 
 Treatment: Restore breathing and circulation, control bleeding, relieve pain, treat wounds. Ensure airway stays open. If no nervous system injuries, have them lie down. Raise feet about 12 inches to increase blood flow to vital organs. Keep victim warm.
Place one victim's arm around your neck and hold that hand. Place other arm around victim's waist to support their weight.
Drag a person by both ankles over a smooth surface if they cannot otherwise be moved and you do not suspect a nervous injury
For rough surfaces or if a person has a nervous injury. Grab clothing behind the shoulder and pull
Roll person onto a blanket or tarp and pull them using the covering
Carry a person who does not weigh much and you do not suspect has a nervous injury by placing one arm under their knees and one around their upper back
